objenome.op

Class EpoxParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.op.EpoxParser

  • public class EpoxParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This parser is for parsing valid Epox programs into a node tree. It is only able to parse those node types which have been declared through the parser's declare methods. If the constructor's load parameter is set to true then all the built-in Epox node types will be loaded into the parser at construction.
    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    Node

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public Node parse(java.lang.String source)
           throws MalformedProgramException
        Parses an Epox program string as an executable Node tree. The given source parameter must contain a valid Epox program string, comprised only of nodes that have been declared. The data-types of each function's inputs must correspond to valid data-types, otherwise a MalformedProgramException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        source - the program string to be parsed as an Epox program.
        Returns:
        a Node which is the root of a tree which is equivalent to the provided source string. A null value will be returned if the source parameter is null.
        Throws:
        MalformedProgramException - if the given string does not represent a valid Epox program.

      • declare

        public void declare(Node node)
        Declares a node so that the parser is able to parse nodes of this type. The identifier of the node is used to identify nodes of this type in the source.
        Parameters:
        node - an instance of the node type to declare

      • undeclare

        public void undeclare(Node node)
        Removes a node so that the parser will no longer parse nodes of this type. The identifier of the node must match the identifier from when it was declared.
        Parameters:
        node - an instance of a node type that should no longer be parsed

      • load

        protected void load()
        Loads the built-in Epox node types
